prompt: <description>Part 1: A Curved Rectangular Prism Step 1: Creating the coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.375, 0.0] Step 2: Drawing the 2D sketch 1. Create a new face (face_1) and start a new sketch on this face. 2. Draw a line (line_1) from point [0.0, 0.0] to point [0.5, 0.0]. 3. Draw a line (line_2) from point [0.5, 0.0] to point [0.5, 0.375]. 4. Draw a line (line_3) from point [0.5, 0.375] to point [0.4727, 0.375]. 5. Draw a line (line_4) from point [0.4727, 0.375] to point [0.4727, 0.0898]. 6. Draw an arc (arc_1) clockwise starting from point [0.4727, 0.0898] with its midpoint at [0.4544, 0.0456] and ending at point [0.4102, 0.0273]. 7. Draw a line (line_5) from point [0.4102, 0.0273] to point [0.0, 0.0273]. 8. Draw a line (line_6) from point [0.0, 0.0273] to point [0.0, 0.0]. *Note: The loop consists of 6 lines and 1 arc.* Step 3: Transforming the 2D sketch into 3D 1. Scale the sketch by 0.5, using the 'sketch_scale' parameter provided in the extrusion section. 2. Apply the Euler Angles and Translation Vector from the coordinate system definition to rotate and translate the 2D sketch in 3D space. Step 4: Extruding the 2D sketch Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal by 0.1875 units and along the opposite direction by 0.1875 units as well, to obtain a final prism. Description - Shape: A rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length (actual length is 0.5), 1 unit in width (actual width is 0.375), and 0.5 units in height (actual height is 0.5). Create the first loop of the face by drawing four lines in the following order: - Line 1: Begin at [0.0, 0.0] and end at [0.75, 0.0]. - Line 2: Begin at [0.75, 0.0] and end at [0.75, 0.2647]. - Line 3: Begin at [0.75, 0.2647] and end at [0.0, 0.2647]. - Line 4: Begin at [0.0, 0.2647] and end at [0.0, 0.0]. 3. Close the loop. The loop should now be formed of four connected lines. **Sketching the Cylindrical Hole:** 1. Create a second loop on the same face. Use the 'circle' tool with the following parameters: - Center: [0.375, 0.1324] - Radius: 0.0882 2. Close the loop. **Extruding the Sketch:** 1. Set the extrude depth towards the normal to 0.4412. 2. Set the extrude depth opposite the normal to 0.0. 3. Set the sketch scale to 0.75. 4. Perform a 'New Body Feature Operation' to create a new solid body using this extrusion. **Finalizing the Shape:** 1. The final shape should have the following dimensions: - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.75 - Height: 0.4412 2. The shape is a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. The cylindrical hole has a diameter of 1 unit. Continue this process for the subsequent parts as necessary, using the information provided in the CAD Assembly JSON. Each part will require a new coordinate system and a new set of sketches and extrusions.</description>
